alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:17AM CDT until May 06 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Flint Creek near Kansas affecting Cherokee and Delaware Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint Creek near Kansas. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs from Fidlers Bend to Chewey Bridge. Floating the Illinois River is unsafe. Permanent campgrounds and a few cabins may become isolated by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
